g.H3701: silver (from its pale color); by implication, money
g.H3389: Jerushalaim or Jerushalem, the capital city of Palestine
g.H730: a cedar tree (from the tenacity of its roots)
g.H834: who, which, what, that; also (as an adverb and a conjunction) when, where, how, because, in order that, etc.
g.H8219: Lowland, i.e. (with the article) the maritime slope of Palestine

g.H834: who, which, what, that; also (as an adverb and a conjunction) when, where, how, because, in order that, etc.
g.H5483: a horse (as leaping); also a swallow (from its rapid flight)
g.H4161: a going forth, i.e. (the act) an egress, or (the place) an exit; hence, a source or product; specifically, dawn, the rising of the sun (the East), ...
g.H4714: Mitsrajim, i.e. Upper and Lower Egypt
g.H4723: something waited for, i.e. confidence (objective or subjective); also a collection, i.e. (of water) a pond, or (of men and horses) a caravan or drove
g.H5503: to travel round (specifically as a pedlar); intensively, to palpitate
g.H3947: to take (in the widest variety of applications)

g.H5927: to ascend, intransitively (be high) or actively (mount); used in a great variety of senses, primary and secondary, literal and figurative
g.H3318: to go (causatively, bring) out, in a great variety of applications, literally and figuratively, direct and proxim.
g.H4714: Mitsrajim, i.e. Upper and Lower Egypt
g.H8337: six (as an overplus  beyond five or the fingers of the hand); as ord. sixth
g.H3967: a hundred; also as a multiplicative and a fraction
g.H3701: silver (from its pale color); by implication, money
g.H5483: a horse (as leaping); also a swallow (from its rapid flight)
g.H3651: properly, set upright; hence (figuratively as adjective) just; but usually (as adverb or conjunction) rightly or so (in various applications to man...
g.H3027: a hand (the open one (indicating power, means, direction, etc.),
g.H3605: properly, the whole; hence, all, any or every (in the singular only, but often in a plural sense)
g.H2850: a Chittite, or descendant of Cheth
g.H758: Aram or Syria, and its inhabitants; also the name of the son of Shem, a grandson of Nahor, and of an Israelite
